Reviews.Title: Better than its Belkin twin but still of limited use
Reviews.Author: Lon J. Seidman "lon@ lon.tv"

logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo22V1VJ7VWK3XRcurrentClick) { return cv_mo22V1VJ7VWK3XRcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 4:33 MinsThis camera is identical to the terrible Belkin NetCam HD, but it does function a little bit better - mainly because the manufacturer is not pushing the device further than its limited hardware specs will allow.The +Cam Pro will only work with the iSecurity+ app that's available for smart phones - it won't work with PC's, Macs or any other device other than an Android or iPhone. There is no tablet specific app available even though the packaging shows it running on an iPad. While it's possible to load the iPhone version on the iPad it'll be running in the iPhone emulation mode.Once the app is installed setup is relatively easy. The camera very quickly appears on the iPhone screen. Unlike the Belkin the framerate is decent but the image quality is heavily compressed and rather poor. It is probably good enough for surveillance purposes but the resolution may make it difficult to see fine details. Video can be recorded and automatically inserted into the iPhone's camera roll but only when the app is open and active.The camera offers audio and motion detection using iSecurity's cloud services. The camera will continuously transmit to the iSecurity servers and is supposed to alert the user to events that require attention. The service is free for now during its beta period, which is a good thing considering it doesn't work. Despite considerable motion the camera and app failed to record a motion event and notify me.The bottom line? Compared to the Belkin this is the better camera. But both are considerably overpriced for the rather limited functionality they provide.DISCLOSURE: Imogen provided me with a sample product to review.

Reviews.Title: Minus 2 stars for usability and some absurdities
Reviews.Author: Erin
Reviews.Content: I got two of these to keep tabs on my cats whenever I'm away. They're easy to set up (though it's kind of ridiculous to require a smartphone to do so). The picture isn't fabulous, but it picks up sounds well.One thing I can't stand, though, is the interface to view the cameras and events. These cameras weren't cheap for me, so I had hoped for much better.- You can't view video on your smartphone on 3G, while YouTube seems to hum along just fine on it, so not sure why this company can't stream that way. So you need a wifi connection.- There's a 5-minute limit to viewing a camera, whether you're using your smartphone or a computer. So if I want to monitor my pet sitter's visit, I have to refresh 5 times.- I wish there were a way to save video besides whenever an "event" (motion) occurs.- Nighttime motion detection is pretty bad. Sometimes even the daytime motion detection is bad. My oldest cat is small, but she's easily distinguishable as a black object against a light background. The camera often didn't detect her, even when she'd walk close to the camera on the ground. I turned the sensitivity all of the way up, but it only captured some of my pet sitter's movements, not the cat.- The video is hit and miss in terms of actually loading, particularly for "events."- There is absolutely no way to mass-delete videos. If I know that the entire first page of videos is all of my youngest cat adjusting her position in her cat tree, I can't select all ten and just delete them. I have to click them one by one and wait for the page to reload.- If something had happened while I was gone, there was no indication that I could save the video (and it "expires" after a week). I stumbled across it while idly clicking around.I'd also prefer to be able to stream this to another server instead of their interface, and while I knew this before I purchased the camera, if I knew how frustrating it'd be to use, I would have chosen another camera.

Reviews.Title: Very poor video
Reviews.Author: Justin G Condon
Reviews.Content: Price is good, setup is easy, but I should have figured - video quality is very poor for my specific use. I placed the camera up high on kitchen closets looking down on entire kitchen / living room space to keep an eye on my dogs while out... can make out the shapes and colors, but that's about it - no clarity, very blurry. Will be returning & looking for something else.

Reviews.Title: Not Up To Speed
Reviews.Author: Walter Neff
Reviews.Content: The connection repeatedly times out and you have to keep refreshing it, which is a pain.  Tried to get help from customer service, but they just told me to try different internet source and then gave me a free trial of some motion detection feature.  Bottom line is that wireless is probably not quite there for video.

Reviews.Title: Great Wifi Camera
Reviews.Author: efranktank
Reviews.Content: This camera has been great. It was easy to set up and the apps for both iOS and Android work great also. I would recommend this camera to anyone looking for a good Wireless camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Leandro L Massaro
Reviews.Content: This is exactly what I was looking for; this camera is great. I was able to get the camera setup and connected to my iphone within minutes. I purchased a two more cameras after my initial purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great as a baby monitor
Reviews.Author: FrankesX5
Reviews.Content: Loved the quick & easy set up. Logs in fast and loads camera much faster than the product I used before. Looking forward to getting a second one for the other child's room.

Reviews.Title: Works great, even in Beta testing
Reviews.Author: Duderino
Reviews.Content: Really high quality video surveillance and recording. Auto-night mode works perfectly every time. The iSecurity app works really well with it. App is easy to use and easy to help set it up. in fact it works so well that when it's a cloudy day, I get a million notifications because the sunlight brightening and dimming will be enough to set it off (but not a consistently spinning ceiling fan or a loose piece of tissue...which is a good thing).I highly recommend this product and even the Seedonk service that is offered with it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!
Reviews.Author: Andrea Druml
Reviews.Content: Love this camera! We use it to check in on our dog and have not had one issue with it.

Reviews.Title: Very hard to set up and I could not do it.
Reviews.Author: George B.
Reviews.Content: After trying for 5 days to install this product with no success I gave up and returned it.this product was very time consuming and difficult to set up.

Reviews.Title: Would buy another one for the other rooms.
Reviews.Author: Douangdy R.
Reviews.Content: It was simple to set up. Sound n picture are clear. Only downside is that it does not automatically rotate to observe other areas. It does give great views of the entire space if positioned at the right angle.

Reviews.Title: It'll do....
Reviews.Author: Jessie D
Reviews.Content: This is a decent product, but lacks some of the sophistication of similar cameras that are a little more expensive.  For our "dog-cam" it was adequate, but we wish we would've spend more money on a camera that really can move/zoom and has two-way speakers.

Reviews.Title: Works great and has good picture.
Reviews.Author: Nathan Stewart
Reviews.Content: Camera works great.  Easy to hook up to wifi.  I can check in on my family and my dogs while I am at work.  Am considering buying a couple more for the office and around the house.Night vision little tough to see at 25 feet, but it works for what I use it for.

Reviews.Title: Amazing in its simplicity
Reviews.Author: M. Sieber "22Tango"
Reviews.Content: Amazing in its simplicity, the ImogenStudio exceeded my expectations for ease of setup, versatility (can be viewed on handhelds and laptops), and high-end performance.  Technology is great when it makes your life easier...my motto,,,and this camera meets that sentiment.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera
Reviews.Author: imani42 "imani"
Reviews.Content: I have several older Imogen Studio cameras that am very pleased with, but I really like the features of this new camera. The setup was simple, as usual, no tech expertise required.  The ability to pan, tilt and zoom makes it even more useful than my other cameras.  I was a beta tester, so I got to use it with the iSecurity + video app, a nice upgrade from iSecurity + snapshots, both record, but the video version is better. Motion detection and notification is a great feature, making it easier for me to monitor my elderly mother, without constantly having to log onto the website.I plan to purchase 2 of these cameras.  I am a big fan of Seedonk, the people and their products; great customer service.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding!!
Reviews.Author: greenwasabi
Reviews.Content: I wanted something easy to use to monitor my kids while I'm away and what I got was something so much more than expected.1, it is very easy to set up, in fact it took less than 5mins and best of all there are no programming or anything else involved. Once set up, the units worked and performed flawlessly!2, the live feed and audio off the monitors are amazing (daytime/night time); I can see and hear in real time without any delay or buffering off my iPhone5/ iPad!3, the pricing is outstanding also-- it is so affordable that we ended up owning 3units!If you are searching for an all in one unit, look no further!Definitely a 5Star rating; I'd give it more if possible!!

Reviews.Title: Amazing little product!!
Reviews.Author: MMickool
Reviews.Content: The ImogenStudio +Cam Pro is absolutely the best wireless camera I have ever owned. Easy to set up, great quality, OTA firmware updates, what more you could ask for!
